summary: This is a letter from the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, disclosing interview notes and FBI 302s as confidential material under the protective order. The document serves as a formal disclosure of investigative materials to the defense.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signatory of the disclosure letter to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, representing the U.S. Department of Justice.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, addressed in the disclosure letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Mark Cohen
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, addressed in the disclosure letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, addressed in the disclosure letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jeffrey Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, addressed in the disclosure letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, addressed in the disclosure letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell), who is the subject of the disclosed interview materials.

connections.description: Everdell is listed as defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell in the case.
Cohen is listed as defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell in the case.
Menninger is listed as defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell in the case.
Pagliuca is listed as defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell in the case.
Sternheim is listed as defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell in the case.
Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is prosecuting the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Disclosure of Interview Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office formally discloses interview notes and FBI 302s to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel as part of discovery in the criminal case.

locations: Silvio J. Motto Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022
Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., 150 East Tenth Avenue, Denver, CO 80203
Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim, 33 West 19th Street-4th Fl., New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office disclosed interview notes and FBI 302s (documents SDNY_GM_00332929 through SDNY_GM_00332942) to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.
The disclosed materials are designated as 'Confidential' under the Protective Order in the case.
The document reveals that multiple law firms and attorneys (Cohen & Gresser, Haddon Morgan and Foreman, and Bobbi Sternheim's office) were representing Ghislaine Maxwell.
The letter is dated October 24, 2020, during the pre-trial phase of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.
